intro: Acranthera yatesii, commonly known as the Yates' acranthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, fragrant flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers that attract pollinators such as moths and bees. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
